I'll get hate but don't care, Toronto being under Columbus, Buffalo, Ottawa, Detroit, and a few others is laughable. A lot of those teams haven't been able to get out of the basement for a decade and the Leafs are a yearly top 10 team who was in the 2nd round just last season

I'll get hate but don't care, Toronto being under Columbus, Buffalo, Ottawa, Detroit, and a few others is laughable. A lot of those teams haven't been able to get out of the basement for a decade and the Leafs are a yearly top 10 team who was in the 2nd round just last season

Being "a yearly Top-10 team" and "in the 2nd round (2 seasons ago)" isn't super relevant when your GM has been there for only 1 season.

Also, you gotta remember that Treliving's last year in Calgary was pretty much a fart in the elevator.

Did you guys have any changes over the summer?

I know Bowman put us at the 25th despite being 2 goals away from a cup.

They moved all their money onto the defense and goaltending for the first time ever. Should see a big improvement on that end of the ice plus you know, a whole new coaching staff.

Regardless, in the context I said, it is laughable.

Being "a yearly Top-10 team" and "in the 2nd round (2 seasons ago)" isn't super relevant when your GM has been there for only 1 season.

And what have the other GM's have to show they are better outside of continuing to not even sniff a playoff spot?

#20

And what have the other GM's have to show they are better outside of continuing to not even sniff a playoff spot?

Steve Staios just traded a cap dump for the reigning Vezina winner and Don Waddell didn't do much but had a pretty good track record in Carolina. Staios couldn't have been expected to do much, considering he joined a team that was 13-18-0-0, and Don Waddell just joined Columbus, and thus can't be meaningfully measured on that scale.

Also, they both aren't Brad Treliving.

Leafs should be 13-17

They are behind the Buffalo Sabres who haven't made the playoffs in 13 years.

Detroit who is going for year 9.

Ottawa who is going for year 8

Utah who hasn't played a game as Utah and is the former Arizona

Then you get to Chicago, SJ and the Ducks.

The Athletic should be ashamed to post this.

Yet again, the Leafs have their best roster in 30+ years and have done absolutely nothing close to successful with it. And their new GM is making the same bad deals their last GM was making.

The difference between the public perception of what Washington is doing and what the fans think is pretty stark. Have always thought BMac was underrated across the league and this helps to confirm that.

I'd knock them down 5 spots simply for taking PLD with no retention for no compensation.

Yet again, the Leafs have their best roster in 30+ years and have done absolutely nothing close to successful with it. And their new GM is making the same bad deals their last GM was making.

I'd knock them down 5 spots simply for taking PLD with no retention for no compensation.

Give me a legitimate argument for Toronto to be lower than Buffalo, you can't because their isn't one.

When you miss the playoffs for 13 straight years you don't belong anywhere but last.

The Buffalo Sabres are the worst run team in the league, with a 13 year playoff drought it can't be anybody but them.
